org.odk.collect.android.utilities

Class DialogUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.odk.collect.android.utilities.DialogUtils

  • public final class DialogUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Reusable code between dialogs for keeping consistency

    • Method Detail

      • createActionListView

        @NonNull
public static android.widget.ListView createActionListView(@NonNull
                                                                     android.content.Context context)
        List View used with actions
        Parameters:
        context - UI Context (Activity/Fragment)
        Returns:
        ListView with white divider between items to prevent accidental taps

      • showDialog

        public static void showDialog(android.app.Dialog dialog,
                              android.app.Activity activity)
        Ensures that a dialog is shown safely and doesn't causes a crash. Useful in the event of a screen rotation, async operations or activity navigation.
        Parameters:
        dialog - that needs to be shown
        activity - that has the dialog

      • createErrorDialog

        public static android.app.Dialog createErrorDialog(@NonNull
                                                   android.app.Activity activity,
                                                   java.lang.String errorMsg,
                                                   boolean shouldExit)
        Creates an error dialog on an activity
        Parameters:
        errorMsg - The message to show on the dialog box
        shouldExit - Finish the activity if Ok is clicked

      • getDialog

        @Deprecated
 @Nullable
public static <T extends androidx.fragment.app.DialogFragment> T getDialog(java.lang.Class<T> dialogClass,
                                                                                                    androidx.fragment.app.FragmentManager fragmentManager)
        Deprecated. 
        It can be a bad idea to interact with Fragment instances. As much as possible we should be using arguments (for static data the dialog needs), Dagger (for dependencies) or ViewModel (for non static data) to get things into fragments so as to avoid crashes or weirdness when they are recreated.

      • showIfNotShowing

        public static <T extends androidx.fragment.app.DialogFragment> void showIfNotShowing(java.lang.Class<T> dialogClass,
                                                                                     androidx.fragment.app.FragmentManager fragmentManager)
